solution_line_template: First triple the amount of milk to find the amount of chicken stock: {milk_quarts} quarts * {chicken_stock_multiplier} = <<{milk_quarts}*{chicken_stock_multiplier}={chicken_stock_quarts}>>{chicken_stock_quarts} quarts

Then add all three quantities to find the total volume of the soup: {chicken_stock_quarts} quarts + {milk_quarts} quarts + {vegetable_quarts} quart = <<{chicken_stock_quarts}+{milk_quarts}+{vegetable_quarts}={total_soup_quarts}>>{total_soup_quarts} quarts

Finally, divide the number of quarts by the number of quarts per bag to find the number of bags needed: {total_soup_quarts} quarts / {quarts_per_bag} quarts/bag = <<{total_soup_quarts}/{quarts_per_bag}={num_bags_needed}>>{num_bags_needed} bags
